title: Drawing, "Wall elevation"
markings:
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
Watermark: lily in double circle, above a geometrical shape (RB'45)
inscribed:
Lower right corner: 48

At right: Gabinetto scartato perche/ e troppo ricco, i pilastri devono/ essere di marmo pario i fon/ di di porfido verde, con/ Rabeschi di metallo do/ rato. Sopra e in mezzo una fi-/ gura di mosaico, e i due cinoli/ [di cancelled] due camei in alabastro, le cor-/ nici di marmo intagliate, ed (?) li/ tondi di metallo, le mostre/ ?n?dini di marmo intagliate, la vulta con stucchi/ dorati, e quadri. (RB'45)

Alternate transcription of inscription on catalogue card.
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Below inscription is written at right, below what evidently is a sketch of the decoration fo the ceiling, and over a sketch of what seems to be the frame fo a niche, with a figure on top. At left is the elevation. A mantlepiece with a looking glass is separated by a pilaster, the decoration of which is described in teh caption, from a door, above which is a rectangular representation. On the other side of the door are two pilasters separated by two short panels, one above the other. The entablature has a frieze with festoons. Above the vaulted lower part of teh ceiling with an octagonal and an oval representation.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Wall elevation".
Pen and brown ink. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1634.
